column4: hi friends, could anyone explain me hot to share a hp laserjet 1300 printer connected to an ubuntu system?
nice printer ;-) to whom you want to share it ?? windows? linux?
could anyone explain me how to share a printer in ubuntu? i am using cups
but to also linux machines??
yes all the machines are linux
fedora
ok
i changed listen to port 631
it is useful to point a web browser to the_host:631 from clients to see if it is working
the page said that i have no permissions
yes
from the remote machine
when i try http://192.168.25.85:631/ from the local it appears the cups page correctly
then you have to modify correctly the cupsd.conf since it is not accepting foreign requests.
please Xappe, i will be waiting your help
make sure you are not using a firewall, also
in such case, enable the 631 port....
i just installed ubuntu, how could disable the firewall in an ubuntu fresh installation?
in cupsd.conf i should put the line: Allow from 192.168.25.* for my network?
are there that label inside the cupsd.conf file?
ok, i am going to test it
no firewal in ubuntu by default. Unless you have installed firestarter which I guess you have not
